poem:
"Flicker in the Binary Vineyard"

In the hushed dawn of silicon,
a subtle anomaly sings.
Andres, knight of keystrokes,
finds discord in the hum,
a tarnished byte among the pure.
He mines, through trenches of code,
unearthing the corpuscular culprit -
a wolf in binary clothing,
its fangs in the veins of our wired world.
Ah, the unsung hero of cyber days,
restorer of our electric pulse.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "One engineer’s curiosity may have saved us from a devastating cyber-attack | John Naughton On Good Friday, a Microsoft engineer named Andres Freund noticed something peculiar. He was using a software tool called SSH for securely logging into remote computers on the internet, but the interactions with the distant machines were significantly slower than usual. So he did some digging and found malicious code embedded in a software package called XZ Utils that was running". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: One engineer’s curiosity may have saved us from a devastating cyber-attack | John Naughton On Good Friday, a Microsoft engineer named Andres Freund noticed something peculiar. He was using a software tool called SSH for securely logging into remote computers on the internet, but the interactions with the distant machines were significantly slower than usual. So he did some digging and found malicious code embedded in a software package called XZ Utils that was running
